ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: French 276 focuses on caricatures and comedic texts from 19th century France. Madame Girard is very, very French and, in general, quite lovely.
Taking it - it's a great class.

You will learn about wit and satire; most of the course is about 19th century Parisian caricatures, but you also come away from the course to understand contemporary humor. If cultural fluency is important to you, take this courseand do the readings. Dont take this course in order to practice your French because you wont generally do much speaking. Also, the course was at 9am on Monday/Wednesday for me; dont do that to yourself. I had never had a class that early before, and it was amazed by how difficult it was to stay engaged, arrive on time, and come prepared.

It's a really interesting class and the material is fun and unexpected. I would recommend it if you want to take a low-key, upper-level French class. If you're looking to improve your speaking skills, though, don't take this class because we barely spoke. it was more just Professor Girard giving us information.
I would definitely recommend it. Excellent class

Take this course. Marie-Helene is a great professor and very knowledgeable in a range of subjects: history, linguistics, art, current events, etc. She can comment on anything. Most of class time was spent listening to these interesting tidbits of knowledge. Taking the course instilled in me an appreciation for satirical images. I really enjoyed trying to analyze them and learned how to elucidate their meaning from signs and references in the images themselves. Marie-Helene is also keen to make you aware of the historical context in which images arise. I think the theme of the course changes every year, but keep this piece of advice in mind when you write essays for any of her classes.
